body:
## Steps to Reproduce

When `flutter run` on a iphone simulator, studio get stuck but the iphone simulator works well.
 
## Version info

```
[‚úì] Flutter (Channel stable, v1.17.2, on Mac OS X 10.15.4 19E287, locale zh-Hans-CN)
    ‚Ä¢ Flutter version 1.17.2 at /Users/chenenyu/development/flutter
    ‚Ä¢ Framework revision 5f21edf8b6 (6 days ago), 2020-05-28 12:44:12 -0700
    ‚Ä¢ Engine revision b851c71829
    ‚Ä¢ Dart version 2.8.3


[‚úì] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK version 29.0.3)
    ‚Ä¢ Android SDK at /Users/chenenyu/development/AndroidSDK
    ‚Ä¢ Platform android-29, build-tools 29.0.3
    ‚Ä¢ ANDROID_HOME = /Users/chenenyu/development/AndroidSDK
    ‚Ä¢ Java binary at: /Applications/Android Studio.app/Contents/jre/jdk/Contents/Home/bin/java
    ‚Ä¢ Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_242-release-1644-b3-6222593)
    ‚Ä¢ All Android licenses accepted.

[‚úì] Xcode - develop for iOS and macOS (Xcode 11.5)
    ‚Ä¢ Xcode at /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer
    ‚Ä¢ Xcode 11.5, Build version 11E608c
    ‚Ä¢ CocoaPods version 1.8.3

[‚úì] Android Studio (version 4.0)
    ‚Ä¢ Android Studio at /Applications/Android Studio.app/Contents
    ‚Ä¢ Flutter plugin version 46.0.2
    ‚Ä¢ Dart plugin version 193.7361
    ‚Ä¢ Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_242-release-1644-b3-6222593)

[‚úì] IntelliJ IDEA Community Edition (version 2019.1.3)
    ‚Ä¢ IntelliJ at /Applications/IntelliJ IDEA CE.app
    ‚Ä¢ Flutter plugin version 34.0.4
    ‚Ä¢ Dart plugin version 191.6183.88

[‚úì] VS Code (version 1.45.1)
    ‚Ä¢ VS Code at /Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents
    ‚Ä¢ Flutter extension version 3.10.2

[‚úì] Connected device (1 available)
    ‚Ä¢ MI 8 UD ‚Ä¢ 6ef9f1d3 ‚Ä¢ android-arm64 ‚Ä¢ Android 10 (API 29)

‚Ä¢ No issues found!
```
studio thread dump: 
[dump1.txt](https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/files/4722761/dump1.txt)

comment_data.body: btw, it works well in a demo project.  üò¢

Thanks for the thread dump and flutter doctor output. A few other questions below.

Can you tell us about some of the qualities of your project where this happened? In particular:
- Is this an entirely Flutter project or is it add to app?
- Is your code all Dart or does it include Java modules?

What other plugins do you have installed in Android Studio?

Can you post a screenshot of your computer's Activity Monitor memory tab? 

(Note to team - I was unable to reproduce with the same Flutter, Dart, Android Studio, Flutter plugin, and Dart plugin versions üòû)

It's an entirely flutter project with many flutter modules and plugins.
All plugins of the android studio:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6647088/83706068-20b86400-a649-11ea-920b-39df78936413.png)

Monitor about cpu/memory:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6647088/83705786-6c1e4280-a648-11ea-8e7a-2083880e1c2c.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6647088/83705707-442edf00-a648-11ea-8cce-174a2f5bf56d.png)

When `flutter run` on android devices, the studio works well.

The "Console filters" thread looks suspicious. Any chance you could copy (or screenshot) the Flutter console? I suspect an error message is causing the regexp to hit a performance problem. The error might not have been printed yet, though. When you run it in a terminal emulator do you see any error messages? If so, can you attach them (nothing proprietary)?

It's ok when execute `flutter run` in the studio's built-in terminal, and the verbose log seems normal.
[build-verbose.log](https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/files/4733634/build-v.log)
Thanks for the log file! It does look like there may be a problem with a new regexp.

So I managed to build again on iOS devices/simulators by reverting Android Studio to 3.6.3 and downloading `flutter-intellij` to 45.1.1. üéâ 

Hope you guys find a solution soon, thanks a lot :)

Yep, it was added in 46, so 45 should work. The fix should be available in the next dev channel build, which will be out June 14.

https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/wiki/Dev-Channel
Same here, before i run iphone emulator it works as expected, but when i start iphone emulator and type something it will freeze even i should close android studio by Force Quit app

This was fixed with #4605, and will be in the next dev channel build (as mentioned before).

Leaving this open until then .

title: android studio 4.0 get stuck after flutter run on a iphone simulator
